title: Henfield Walks

images.title: Peter Cox / Pond at Henfield
images.caption: Pond at Henfield. One of several ponds in the area whose outlets run across the brooks south of the village to join the Adur.

images.title: Ian Cunliffe / Meadows near the River Adur - south of Henfield
images.caption: Meadows near the River Adur - south of Henfield. This is a view to the west from the disused railway track.

images.title: Simon Carey / Northover Pumping Station
images.caption: Northover Pumping Station. Marking the point where the stream joins the River Adur which is beyond the embankments.

images.title: Simon Carey / River Adur
images.caption: River Adur. Taken from the footpath that follows the western bank of the river.

images.title: Peter Cox / Bineham bridge over the river Adur
images.caption: Bineham bridge over the river Adur. Walkers, horse riders and cyclists of a nervous disposition must be grateful that West Sussex CC have replaced the previous effort at a bridge by this superb structure. Bineham was known as Bredham or Bredman in the sixteenth century and in those days crossed two channels of the Adur.

images.title: Simon Carey, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Downs link. Long distance footpath and bridleway that links Shoreham to Guildford along the course of a couple of dismantled railways. This section lies between Betley Bridge and West End Lane on the edge of Henfield.

images.title: Simon Carey / River Adur at Betley Bridge
images.caption: River Adur at Betley Bridge

description: This large village in West Sussex has some nice riverside and country trails to try. It's also close to the South Downs National Park which can be reached on foot on a handy waymarked trail runnning through the village. The village has an attractive centre with a historic 13th century church, a 17th century pub and the photogenic Cat House with its thatched roof. This route from Henfield uses a section of the Downs Link and riverside trails to create a circular walk around the area. The route starts on the western side of the village where you can pick up the Downs Link. This shared cycling and walking trail can be followed north to Betley Bridge on the River Adur. You can then follow a pleasant riverside footpath south to Bineham Bridge and Stretham Manor. Here you can pick up the Downs Link again and follow the trail north back into Henfield.
